metadata.author: Pai et al.
metadata.description: Induces complete, functional eye formation in non-neural tissue (gut, tail, lateral flank) by establishing a hyperpolarized eye-field prepattern.

bioelectric_state.notes: Requires establishing a hyperpolarized domain mimicking the natural Anterior Neural Field.

control_loop.monitoring_frequency: Every 6 hours from Stage 10.5 to Stage 24

feedback_mechanism.corrective_action: If drift above -25mV: Apply booster injection of 0.5 ng Kv1.5 mRNA. If drift below -55mV: Reduce by allowing endogenous depolarization for 2 hours before re-measuring.

termination_criteria.anatomical_marker: Formation of optic cup (Stage 24) with visible lens placode
termination_criteria.bioelectric_marker: Hyperpolarized domain normalizes to -40mV as eye field commits

delivery_method.timing: 4-cell stage (NF Stage 3), target ventral blastomere V1
delivery_method.notes: Single-cell microinjection ensures spatial specificity. Avoid injection into dorsal cells to prevent neural plate interference.

hardware_drivers.name: Kv1.5
hardware_drivers.dosage: 1-2 ng per blastomere (initial), 0.5 ng (booster if needed)

metadata.author: Adams et al.
metadata.description: Rescues or induces tail regeneration in non-regenerative contexts (refractory period) by driving proton efflux.

bioelectric_state.notes: Relies on H+ pumping to drive Vmem change; can be substituted by non-native pumps (Yeast PMA1).

control_loop.monitoring_frequency: Every 4 hours for first 24h, then every 12 hours until tail elongation completes

feedback_mechanism.corrective_action: If drift above +5mV (excessive depolarization): Reduce proton pump activity or wait for homeostatic correction. If drift below -25mV: Apply secondary mRNA injection to regeneration bud.

termination_criteria.anatomical_marker: Tail reaches 50% of control length with visible fin fold and notochord extension
termination_criteria.bioelectric_marker: Regeneration bud returns to baseline Vmem (-15mV to -20mV) indicating completion

delivery_method.timing: Immediately post-amputation (within 1 hour), direct injection into amputation plane
delivery_method.notes: Target the blastema/regeneration bud directly. Avoid systemic delivery to prevent ectopic growth.

hardware_drivers.name: V-ATPase
hardware_drivers.dosage: Upregulation via 200 pg constitutively active construct

metadata.author: Emmons-Bell et al.
metadata.description: Induces head morphologies belonging to other species (e.g., S. mediterranea, P. felina) in G. dorotocephala by altering gap junction connectivity.
references: Emmons-Bell et al., 2015, Int. J. Mol. Sci. 16:26065-26087

bioelectric_state.notes: Target is not a single Vmem value but a network topology state (iso-potentiality disruption) achieved via gap junction blockade.

control_loop.monitoring_frequency: Every 12 hours during 48h treatment window, then daily until Day 7

feedback_mechanism.corrective_action: Gap junction blockade is transient; drift is expected and normal. Monitor for head shape emergence rather than strict Vmem maintenance.

termination_criteria.anatomical_marker: Head shape matches target species morphology (wider head, different eye spacing for S. mediterranea phenotype)
termination_criteria.bioelectric_marker: Network connectivity pattern stabilizes (gap junction communication restored post-treatment)

delivery_method.timing: During regeneration window (Day 0-2 post-amputation) for 48 continuous hours
delivery_method.notes: Bath application is systemic by nature. This is acceptable for planaria as entire organism remodels. For localized interventions in larger organisms, consider alternative delivery.

hardware_drivers.name: Gap Junction Blocker (Octanol)
hardware_drivers.dosage: 127 μM in spring water, change daily

metadata.author: Tseng et al.
metadata.description: Induces leg regeneration (including toes and nails) in post-metamorphic frogs that normally cannot regenerate.

bioelectric_state.notes: Intracellular sodium modulation triggers downstream MSX1 expression.

control_loop.monitoring_frequency: Every 8 hours for first 48h, then every 24 hours for 2 weeks

feedback_mechanism.corrective_action: If drift above -5mV: Risk of excessive proliferation; reduce ionophore exposure. If drift below -35mV: Apply secondary ionophore pulse (50% initial dose).

termination_criteria.anatomical_marker: Blastema formation complete with digit condensations visible (4-6 weeks post-treatment)
termination_criteria.bioelectric_marker: Stump returns to resting potential (-20 to -25mV) as regenerative program completes

delivery_method.timing: Immediately post-amputation, implant slow-release bead at stump surface
delivery_method.notes: Slow-release bead (Affi-Gel) soaked in Monensin provides sustained local delivery over 24-48h. Alternative: multiple microinjections at 0h, 12h, 24h.

hardware_drivers.name: Monensin Cocktail
hardware_drivers.dosage: 10 mM stock solution, 50 μL applied to bead or direct stump application
